reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Santorini at its absolute quietest. Explore Fira, Oia, and archaeological sites with virtually no other tourists around.
Benefit from the cheapest rates for flights and the limited accommodation options that remain open, making even caldera-view stays more affordable.
Engage with the island's true character. Enjoy cozy cafes in Fira alongside locals and witness the unhurried winter pace of life.
Cooler temperatures make hiking the Fira-Oia trail feasible and enjoyable on clear, dry days, offering dramatic views without the heat.
Depending on the Orthodox calendar, Carnival often falls in February. Experience local traditions like Tsiknopempti ('Smoky Thursday') or small parades in Fira.
Late February can bring the earliest almond blossoms, adding a touch of beauty to the quiet landscape, especially inland.

reasons_to_reconsider.reason: Coldest Month & High Chance of Rain/Wind
reasons_to_reconsider.details: February is typically Santorini's coldest month (average highs 14-15°C) with a significant chance of rain, strong winds, and overcast days. Pack warm, waterproof gear.
Many hotels, restaurants, shops, and almost all tour operators (especially boat tours) and beach clubs are closed. Fira has the most activity, but options are limited.
Focus is restricted to sightseeing (Fira, Oia, Akrotiri - check hours), museums, hiking (weather permitting), and wine tasting (at few open wineries). No beach life or water sports.
Sea temperature is at its annual minimum (around 15-16°C), making swimming impossible.
Days are still short (sunset around 6:00-6:15 PM by month end), limiting time for outdoor exploration.
Evenings and nights are cold (lows ~9°C). Ensure your accommodation has good heating.

weather.precipitation: High chance of rain and windy conditions, interspersed with occasional sunny days. Can feel damp and chilly.
weather.general_tips: Pack warm layers (fleece, sweaters), a reliable waterproof and windproof jacket, warm hat/scarf, comfortable waterproof walking shoes, and an umbrella.

tourism_level.crowds: Extremely low. Possibly the quietest time of the entire year. Fira is the main center of activity.
tourism_level.pricing: Lowest prices generally available for flights and open accommodation.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Very quiet, peaceful, potentially wet and windy. A true off-season experience focused on local life.

events_holidays.name: Possible start of Apokries (Carnival Period - 'Triodion')
events_holidays.description: Depending on the Orthodox calendar, the three-week Carnival period may begin. Initial signs might include carnival masks/costumes appearing in some shops.
events_holidays.notes: Main events like Tsiknopempti occur later in the period. Check Orthodox Easter dates.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the world-famous village with almost complete solitude. Capture unique photos of the iconic architecture without any crowds.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Very few businesses will be open. Dress warmly. Check bus schedules if not driving. Enjoy the rare peace.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the covered Minoan city ruins without queues. Check winter opening days/times very carefully beforehand.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Indoor site, good for potentially damp days. Requires transport (bus limited, car best). Allow 1.5-2 hours.

unique_experiences.description: Find a warm cafe open for locals, enjoy Greek coffee or hot chocolate, and watch the winter world go by. Experience the island's relaxed off-season rhythm.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Fira offers the best chance of finding open cafes and tavernas.
unique_experiences.best_time: Anytime, especially on a cold or wet day

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the Museum of Prehistoric Thera
unique_experiences.description: Discover artifacts from Akrotiri and learn about the island's ancient past. An excellent indoor activity. Check winter hours.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Centrally located in Fira. Allow 1-1.5 hours.

weather.precipitation: Rain and wind still likely, but potentially longer sunny spells appear. Slight increase in daylight hours.
weather.general_tips: Continue with warm, waterproof layers. Good hiking boots essential if planning walks on potentially muddy trails.

tourism_level.crowds: Remains very low, but can see a temporary influx of local activity in Fira if Tsiknopempti or Carnival parades occur.
tourism_level.pricing: Still low season pricing, maybe slight bumps for specific Carnival weekend dates if hotels are busy.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Can shift from very quiet to locally festive if Carnival is active. First signs of almond blossoms might appear inland.

events_holidays.name: Tsiknopempti ('Smoky Thursday')
events_holidays.date: Varies (usually 11 days before Clean Monday - often late Feb/early Mar)
events_holidays.description: If Apokries falls late Feb: Expect widespread grilling of meat in Fira and villages. Tavernas serving meat will be very busy and smoky.
events_holidays.notes: An authentic, lively local tradition focused on meat feasting before Lent. Book tavernas early.

events_holidays.name: Apokries Parades/Events in Fira (Potential)
events_holidays.date: Varies (peak usually last weekend before Clean Monday - often late Feb/early Mar)
events_holidays.description: Check locally for any small Carnival parades (often involving schools) or events organized in Fira's main square.
events_holidays.notes: Santorini's Carnival is low-key compared to other parts of Greece. Don't expect huge festivities.

events_holidays.name: Almond Blossom Sighting
events_holidays.description: Drive inland on a sunny day to potentially spot the first almond trees blooming, particularly around traditional villages.
events_holidays.notes: Requires transport. A subtle but welcome sign of approaching spring.

unique_experiences.activity: Hike Fira to Oia (Choose a Good Day)
unique_experiences.description: Tackle the famous hike on a clear, dry day. Enjoy breathtaking, crowd-free views. Be prepared for wind and potentially muddy sections.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check weather forecast carefully. Wear sturdy, waterproof boots. Bring water/snacks. Start early due to short daylight.
unique_experiences.best_time: Morning on a clear, dry day

unique_experiences.where: Wineries like Santo Wines, Koutsoyannopoulos Wine Museum
unique_experiences.description: Visit one of the few wineries likely open. Enjoy tasting local Assyrtiko wine in a quiet setting. Call ahead to confirm hours and book if required.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Winter hours are limited. Essential to check beforehand. Offers a warm indoor activity.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the traditional, quiet village up to the Kasteli ruins for panoramic island views. Experience authentic Cycladic architecture without tourists.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Requires transport. Very few facilities likely open. Enjoy the peaceful atmosphere.

unique_experiences.description: If visiting during Apokries, witness Tsiknopempti grilling or seek out small local parades/events for an authentic cultural insight.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check dates based on Orthodox calendar. Be respectful when observing local customs.
